channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Two mattresses by bin store on Long Walk (Westdale Rd end), 21st August
item.description:
Two double mattresses were dumped over a week ago outside the bin store on Long Walk (Westdale Road end). The council staff usually clear this area once a week, but it did not happen this week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westdale Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 swings missing., 21st August
item.description:
Two of swings have been taken for fixing and not replaced.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Seymour Villas, Anerley, London

item.title: Double Mattress next to Westdale Rd carpark, 21st August
item.description:
The double mattress that was originally behind a tree on Westdale Road's grass bank (FixMyStreet ref: 7716717) was moved by council staff on the 14th August, to a position from where it could be collected by the council. It still needs to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westdale Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds around children's playground, 21st August
item.description:
Weeds all over playground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Seymour Villas, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway in Brooksway Park, to the right of newly refurbished metal bridge, is completely overgrown and has disappeared., 21st August
item.description:
Pathway, which leads to the area opposite Crayfields Industrial Estate, has been there for at least forty years and is now completely overgrown and almost impassable. As this is a safe area for nervous dogs some people are still trying to access it ( the pathway is the only route in). This is extremely dangerous as the pathway and the sheer, stone drop down by the side are indistinguishable and someone could easily slip down. Can the pathway be cleared and restored as soon as possible please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown & fuli of rubbish grass verge in Woodpecker Close, 21st August
item.description:
Overgrown & full of rubbish is a grass verge in Woodpecker Close. This grass verge should be REGULARLY maintained and not left until someone complains! It is an eyesore and is making the area depressing to live in.. It would be a surprise if it had been maintained within the past year!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodpecker Close, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike Parking Rack, 21st August
item.description:
The bike parking rack outside the exit of London Fields station has been removed. Commuters rely on the use of the bike rack to safely park their bike outside the station whilst commuting using bike and train.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mentmore Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken climbing equipment, 21st August
item.description:
One of the pegs on the big slide is broken and has sharp edges. Kids still climb on this equipment and I would not be surprised if they scratched themselves on the sharp edges.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: Pothole on footpath near curb, 21st August
item.description:
The pavement is broken up and is a danger to pedestrians as well as cars driving in to the Royal Mail Office. This footpath is used by elderly and wheel chair uses constantly. The potholes are close to a manhole cover and if not sorted could become a much bigger problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In Brooksway Park, Hole in the pathway opposite Main Road just past bench in front of ornamental garden., 21st August
item.description:
Damage has been done to this pathway by those who have been holding barbeques over the summer. This creates lots of mess and damage to the park and is also a fire risk so could we have some signs please stating that no barbeques should be held anywhere in the park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Millwood Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
